wikipedia_page.main: Jonathan Anidjar Romain  (born 24 August 1954, in Hampstead, London, England) is a writer and broadcaster and director of Maidenhead Synagogue in Berkshire, England. He has a PhD in the history of British Jewry. He writes for The Times, The Independent, The Guardian, The Huffington Post, and The Jewish Chronicle and appears on radio and television.

The synagogue became part of the Reform Movement in 1960, so receiving the services of student rabbis of the Leo Baeck College, among them Jonathan Romain who was appointed as the synagogue's first full-time rabbi in 1980. The synagogue moved to larger premises in 2001 and the congregation has grown to 1831 members. An extension to the synagogue, including a new community centre, was opened in 2017.
She is married to Jonathan Romain, Rabbi of Maidenhead Synagogue, and they have four adult sons.
